stem: Choose the correct verb: "The group of students ___ ready."
explanation: "Group" is singular

stem: Choose the correct verb: "Neither the cat nor the dogs ___ outside."
explanation: Verb agrees with closer subject (dogs=plural)

stem: Choose the correct verb: "Each of the books ___ interesting."
explanation: "Each" is singular

stem: Choose the correct verb: "The news ___ shocking."
explanation: "News" is uncountable/singular

stem: Choose the correct verb: "Mathematics ___ my best subject."
explanation: "Mathematics" takes singular verb

stem: Choose the correct verb: "Everyone ___ finished."
explanation: "Everyone" is singular

stem: Choose the correct verb: "One of the students ___ absent."
explanation: "One" is the subject (singular)

stem: Choose the correct verb: "There ___ many options."
explanation: "Options" is plural â†’ "are"

stem: Fix this run-on: "I love pizza it is delicious."

options.label: A
options.text: I love pizza; it is delicious.

options.label: B
options.text: I love pizza, it is delicious.

options.label: C
options.text: I love pizza it is delicious.

options.label: D
options.text: I, love pizza it is delicious.

explanation: Separate independent clauses with conjunction+comma, semicolon, or period.

stem: Fix the comma splice: "I like cats, they are cute."

options.label: A
options.text: I like cats; they are cute.

options.label: B
options.text: I like cats, they are cute.

options.label: C
options.text: I like cats they are cute.

options.label: D
options.text: I like cats and then also they are cute.

explanation: A comma alone cannot join two independent clauses.

stem: Fix the comma splice: "She ran fast, she still lost."

options.label: A
options.text: She ran fast, but she still lost.

options.label: B
options.text: She ran fast, she still lost.

options.label: C
options.text: She ran fast she still lost.

options.label: D
options.text: She ran fast and then also she still lost.

explanation: A comma alone cannot join two independent clauses.

stem: Fix the comma splice: "It rained, we stayed home."

options.label: A
options.text: It rained, so we stayed home.

options.label: D
options.text: It rained and then also we stayed home.

explanation: A comma alone cannot join two independent clauses.

stem: Fix the comma splice: "He smiled, she waved back."

options.label: A
options.text: He smiled, and she waved back.

options.label: D
options.text: He smiled and then also she waved back.

explanation: A comma alone cannot join two independent clauses.

stem: Create parallel structure: "She likes swimming, hiking, and to bike."

options.label: A
options.text: She likes swimming, hiking, and biking.

options.label: B
options.text: She likes swimming, hiking, and to bike.

options.label: C
options.text: and to bike., hiking,She likes swimming

options.label: D
options.text: She likes swimming, hiking, and also biking.

explanation: Items in a series must use matching grammatical forms.

options.label: D

explanation: Items in a series must use matching grammatical forms.

stem: Fix pronoun agreement: "Each student must bring their lunch."

options.label: A
options.text: Each student must bring his or her lunch.

options.label: B
options.text: Each student must bring their lunch.

options.label: C
options.text: Each student must bring our lunch.

options.label: D
options.text: Each student must bring them lunch.

explanation: Pronouns must agree in number with their antecedents.
